Before shoeing off on an out-of-town trip, this Is my recommen¬
dation in response to your Inquiry concerning the NAEB purchase
of "NCS #2."
I recon?r^nd that the NAEB buy the service and that it be made
available to the stations according to the schedule of charges
which the NAFB Board may wish to make for use of the material.
If there is opposition to paying additional funds for such a
service, the Board should consider making the purchase out of
its current funds and distributing relevant state reports at no
®*tra cost to stations requesting them.
The first decision is whether or not to buy. The second decision
is whether or not to make it pay for itself through a system of
charges for use. Perhaps the second decision would have to be
made first; but at any rate, 1 recommend it as a valuable service
for NAFU members who have a sincere interest in ary kind of
audience study and evaluation of their program acceptance and
effectiveness.
